title: COVID-19 Vaccine Appointments
description: Information on scheduling a COVID-19 vaccine
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccine Appointments [Search Vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/) Everyone 6 months and older is eligible and encouraged to get a COVID-19 vaccine. Make sure you stay up to date with primary series doses and boosters. Check [Vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/) for appointments in and around Arlington, which includes pharmacies and other medical providers. Arlington County Vaccine Clinic for Children ages 6 months-11 years: The Public Health Division is offering COVID-19 vaccines to children ages 6 months-11 years by appointment only. Individuals 12 years and older are NOT eligible for vaccine at this location. They are encouraged to visit a local pharmacy, contact their provider, or search for other options at [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/). |LOCATION || | HOURS |VACCINES | | | [Sequoia 1, 2nd floor](https://www.arlingtonva.us/Government/Departments/DHS/DHS-At-a-Glance-Locations-Programs-Contact-Information) 2100 Washington Boulevard | | NEW HOURS Starting May 15 Tuesdays, 8 a.m.-11 a.m. Thursdays, 8 a.m.-11 a.m. and 1 p.m.-4 p.m. Call [703-228-1200](tel:7032281200) for an appointment | | Primary Series and Booster Pfizer Moderna Please note: Children must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian to receive their free COVID-19 vaccine. Please bring any form of identification to confirm your identity (examples include utility bill, paystub, insurance card, or a driver's license).
